episode_title: 205 - The One With Five Steaks and an Eggplant

content.description: Chandler and Joey’s, Ross and Chandler are there. Ross is watching wrestling.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Man, I sure miss Julie.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Spanish midgets. Spanish midgets wrestling. Julie. Ok, yes, I see how you got there. (The phone rings and Chandler doesn’t answer it.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You ever figure out what that thing’s for?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No, see, I’m trying this new screening thing. You know, I figure if I’m always answering the phone, people’ll think I don’t have a life. My god, Rodrigo never gets pinned.

content.speaker: Machine
content.text: Here comes the beep, you know what to do.

content.speaker: Woman’s Voice
content.text: Hello, I’m looking for Bob. This is Jane. I don’t know if you’re still at this number, but I was just thinking about us, and how great it was, and, well, I know it’s been three years, but, I was kinda hoping we could hook up again. I barely had t he nerve to make this call, so you know what I did?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Jade
content.text: I got a little drunk…and naked.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Bob here.
content.parenthetical: answering the phone, in a deep voice

content.description: Chandler and Joey’s, continued from earlier. Ross and Chandler are dancing.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What’ve you been up to?

content.speaker: Jade
content.text: Oh, you know, the usual, teaching aerobics, partying way too much. Oh, and in case you were wondering, those are my legs on the new James Bond poster. (They stop dancing.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Can you hold on a moment? I have another call. (To Ross) I love her.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I know.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I’m back.

content.speaker: Jade
content.text: So, are we gonna get together or what?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Um, absolutely. Uh, how ‘bout tomorrow afternoon? Do you know uh, Central Perk in the Village, say, five-ish?

content.speaker: Jade
content.text: Great, I’ll see you then.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ok. (He hangs up.) Ok. Having a phone has finally paid off.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Even though you do do a good Bob impression, I’m thinkin’ when she sees you tomorow, she’s probably gonna realize, “Hey, you’re not Bob.”

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I’m hoping that when Bob doesn’t show up, she will seek comfort in the open arms of the wry stranger at the next table.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh my god. You are pure evil.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ok, pure evil (holds up his left hand), horny and alone (holds up his right hand). I’ve done this (He shakes his right hand.)

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, everyone is there and Ross is on the phone.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, yeah, everybody’s here. Hey, everybody, say hi to Julie in New Mexico.

content.speaker: All
content.text: Hi, Julie!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi, Julie.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ok, while Ross is on the phone, everybody owes me 62 bucks for his birthday.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Um, is, is there any chance that you’re rounding up? Y’know, like from, like 20?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey, come on, we got the gift, the concert, and the cake.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Do we need a cake?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Look guys, I know it’s a little steep.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, whoosh! (Imitates going over a cliff with her hand.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: But it’s Ross.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: It’s Ross.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, you’re right.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I’ll see you guys later, I gotta go…do a thing.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Ok, sweetheart, I’ll call you later tonight. (He hangs up) (To Chandler) Whoa, whoa, whoa, hey, hey, hey, you’re not really gonna go through with this, are you?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You know, I think I might just.
(They exit.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: So uh, what are you guys doing for dinner tonight?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well I guess I gotta start savin’ up for Ross’s birthday, so I guess I’ll just stay home and eat dust bunnies.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Can you believe how much this is gonna cost?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Do you guys ever get the feeling that um, Chandler and those guys just don’t get that we don’t make as much money as they do?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yes! Yeah, it’s like they’re always saying “let’s go here, let’s go there”. Like we can afford to go here and there.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yes, yes, and it’s, and we always have to go to, y’know, someplace nice, y’know? God, and it’s not like we can say anything about it, ’cause, like this birthday thing, it’s for Ross.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: For Ross.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: For Ross, Ross, Ross.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh my god.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hi.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I’m at work, ordinary day, you know, chop chop chop, sauti, sauti, sauti. All of a sudden, Leon, the manager, calls me into his office. It turns out they fired the head lunch chef, and guess who got the job.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: If it’s not you, this is a horrible story.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Fortunately, it is me. And, they made me head of purchasing, thank you very much. Anyway, I just ran into Ross and Chandler downstairs, and they think we should go out and celebrate. Y’know, someplace nice. (She goes into her bedroom.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, someplace nice.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: How much do you think I can get for my kidney?

content.description: Central Perk, Jade is waiting for Bob to show while Ross and Chandler look on.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I’m tellin’ you. You can’t do this.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, come on. I can never get a girl like that with conventional methods.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: That doesn’t matter. She wanted to call Bob. Hey, for all we know, Bob is who she was meant to be with. You may be destroying two people’s chance for happiness.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: We don’t know Bob! Okay? We know me. We like me. Please let me be happy.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Go over there and tell that woman the truth.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: All right. (He gets up, but swings around the pole back to their table.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Go.
(He walks over to Jade.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hi.

content.speaker: Jade
content.text: Hi.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Listen, I have to, uh, um, I have to, I have to confess something.

content.speaker: Jade
content.text: Yes?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Whoever stood you up is a jerk.

content.speaker: Jade
content.text: How did you…

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I don’t know. (He sits down.) I just had this weird sense. You know, but that’s me. I’m weird and sensitive. Tissue? (Holds out one of this small packs.)

content.speaker: Jade
content.text: Thanks.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No, you keep the pack. I’m all cried out today.
(He looks over at Ross who glares at him.)

content.description: A Restaurant, everyone except Chandler is seated at a table.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Ok, (holding up his glass) ok, here is to my sister, the newly-appointed head lunch chef…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Who is also in charge of purchasing.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Newly appointed head lunch chef who is also in charge of purchasing…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Who has her own little desk when Roland’s not there.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Uh, lunch chef, purchasing, own little desk when Roland’s not there. Here’s to my little sister—

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, wait, and I got a beeper!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Cool.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Let’s see!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: That’s fine, I’ll-I’ll just wait!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, sorry.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Sorry, sorry.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Monica!
(They clink their glasses.)

content.speaker: Waiter
content.text: Are we ready to order?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, you know what, we haven’t even looked yet.

content.speaker: Waiter
content.text: Well, when you do, just let me know. I’ll be right over there on the edge of my seat.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Wow, look at these prices.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, these are pretty ch-ching.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What are these, like famous chickens?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey, sorry I’m late. Congratulations, Mon. (to Ross) I’m not sorry I’m late. How incredible was my afternoon with Jade?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, pretty incredible according to the message she left you on my machine. Hey, Chandler, why is this woman leaving a message for you on my machine?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, see, I had to tell her that my number was your number, because I couldn’t tell her that my number was my number because she thinks that my number is Bob’s number.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey, tell me again, what do I do when Mr. Roper calls?

content.speaker: Waiter
content.text: Do I dare ask?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yes, I will start with the carpaccio, and then I’ll have the grilled prawns.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: That sounds great. Same for me.

content.speaker: Waiter
content.text: And for the gentleman?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, I’ll have the Thai chicken pizza. But, hey, look, if I get it without the nuts and leeks and stuff, is it cheaper?

content.speaker: Waiter
content.text: You’d think, wouldn’t you? Miss?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ok, I will have the uh, (whispers) side salad.

content.speaker: Waiter
content.text: And what will that be on the side of?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Uh, I don’t know. Why don’t you put it right here next to my water?

content.speaker: Waiter
content.text: And for you?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Um, I’m gonna have a cup of the cucumber soup, and, um, take care.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I will have the uh, Cajun catfish.

content.speaker: Waiter
content.text: Anything else?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yes, how ‘bout a verse of Killing Me Softly . You’re gonna sneeze on my fish, aren’t you?
[Time lapse, everyone has finished dinner and Ross is figuring out the bill.]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Plus tip, divided by six. Ok, everyone owes 28 bucks.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Um, everyone?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, you’re right, I’m sorry.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Thank you.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Monica’s big night, she shouldn’t pay.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, thank you!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: So five of us is, $33.50 apiece.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No, huh uh, no way, I’m sorry, not gonna happen.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Whoa, whoa, prom night flashback.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I’m sorry, Monica, I’m really happy you got promoted, but cold cucumber mush for thirty-something bucks? No! Rachel just had that-that-that salad, and, and Joey with his like teeny pizza! It’s just…

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Ok, Pheebs! How ‘bout we’ll each just pay for what we had. It’s no big deal.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Not for you.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: All right, what’s goin’ on?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ok, look you guys, I really don’t want to get into this right now. I think it’ll just make everyone uncomfortable.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Fine. All right, fine.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You can tell us.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hello, it’s us, all right? It’ll be fine.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ok, um, uh, we three feel like, that uh, sometimes you guys don’t get that uh… (Pause) We don’t have as much money as you.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ok.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I hear ya.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: We can talk about that.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, then…Let’s.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well umm I, I just never think of money as an issue.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: That’s ’cause you have it.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: That’s a good point.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: So um, how come you guys haven’t talked about this before?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: ’Cause it’s always somethin’, you know, like with Monica’s new job, or the whole Ross’s birthday hoopla.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Wha—Whoa, hey, I don’t want my birthday to be the source of any kind of negative—there’s gonna be a hoopla?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Basically, there’s the thing, and then there’s the stuff after the thing.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: If it makes anybody feel better, then we can just forget the thing, and we’ll just do the gift.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: G-gift? The thing’s not the gift?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No, the thing was, we were gonna go see Hootie and the Blowfish.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hootie and the—oh my. I, I can catch them on the radio.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No, now I feel bad. You wanna go to the concert.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No, look, hey, it’s my birthday, and the important thing is that we all be together.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: All of us.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Together.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Not at the concert.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ok.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Thank you.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Thanks.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah.
(An awkward silence ensues.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: So, the ebola virus. That’s gotta suck, huh?

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Joey, Phoebe, and Rachel are sitting in the living room as Monica, who’s holding a bag, Ross, and Chandler stand before them.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Gee, Monica, what’s in the bag?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I don’t know, Chandler. Let’s take a look.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, it’s like a skit.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Why, it’s dinner for six. 5 steaks, and an eggplant for Phoebe.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Whoo!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Cool.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah, we switched meat suppliers at work, and the new guys gave me the steaks as sort of a thank you.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: But wait, there’s more. Hey, Chandler, what is in the envelope?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: By the way, this didn’t seem so dorky in the hall.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Come on.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Why, it’s six tickets to Hootie and the Blowfish! (Pause) The Blowfish!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: It’s on us, all right, so don’t worry. It’s our treat.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: So…Thank you.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Could you be less enthused?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Look, it’s a nice gesture, it is. But it just feels like…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Like?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Charity.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Charity?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: We’re just tryin’ to do a nice thing here.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ross, you have to understand that your nice thing makes us feel this big. (Holds her thumb and forefinger a short distance apart.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Actually, it makes us feel that big. (She squeezes Rachel’s thumb and forefinger closer together.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I don’t, I don’t understand. I mean, you, it’s like we can’t win with you guys.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: If you guys feel this big (imitates Rachel’s gesture), maybe that’s not our fault. Maybe that’s just how you feel.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, now you’re tellin’ us how you feel.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ok, we never shoulda talked about this.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I’m just gonna pass on the concert, ’cause I’m just not in a very Hootie place right now.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Me neither.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Me too.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Guys, we bought the tickets.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, well, then you’ll have extra seats y’know, for all your tiaras and stuff.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Why did you look at me when you said that?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well, I guess now we can’t go.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What? Come on, you do what you want to do. Do we always have to do everything together?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You know what? You’re right.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Fine.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Fine. (Exits)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Fine.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Fine. (Exits)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Fine.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: All right. We’re gonna go. (Exits, then comes back in) It’s not for another six hours. We’re gonna go then.

content.description: Chandler and Joey’s, Chandler is standing at the fridge as Ross enters hiding Chandler behind the door.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Chandler!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Geez! Are you ready?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yes. Yes! Just let me grab my jacket and tell you I had sex today.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Whoa! You had sex today?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Wow, it sounds even cooler when somebody else says it. I was awesome, ok? She was biting her lip to stop from screaming.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Wow!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Now I know it’s been awhile, but I took it as a good sign.
(The phone rings and Chandler doesn’t answer it.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Still doing the screening thing?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I had sex today. I never have to answer that phone again.

content.speaker: Machine
content.text: Here comes the beep, you know what to do.

content.speaker: Jade
content.text: Hey, Bob, it’s Jade. Listen, I just wanted to tell you that I was really hurt when you didn’t show up the other day, and just so you know, I ended up meeting a guy.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Bob here.

content.speaker: Jade
content.text: Oh, hi.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: So, uh, you met someone, huh?

content.speaker: Jade
content.text: Yes, yes, I did. In fact, I had sex with him 2 hours ago. (Chandler and Ross dance in joy.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: So, uh, how was he?

content.speaker: Jade
content.text: Eh.
(Pause)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Eh?

content.speaker: Jade
content.text: Oh, Bob, he was nothing compared to you. I had to bite my lip to keep from screaming your name.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, that makes me feel so good.

content.speaker: Jade
content.text: It was just so awkward and bumpy.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Bumpy?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, maybe he had some kind of uh, new, cool style, that you’re not familiar with. And uh maybe you have to get used to it.

content.speaker: Jade
content.text: Well there really wasn’t much time to get used to it, you know what I mean?
(Chandler grimaces.)

content.description: The Concert, Ross, Monica, and Chandler are sitting in their seats looking at the three empty ones.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You know what? I’m not gonna be able to enjoy this.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, I know, it’s my birthday. We all should be here.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: So, let’s go.
(They get up and start to leave, but the band starts to play.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well maybe, you know, maybe we should stay for one song.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, I mean, it would be rude to them (the band) for us to leave now.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You know, the guys are probably having a great time.

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Joey is trying to entertain Phoebe and Rachel.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Come on you guys, one more time.
content.parenthetical: holding a hand behind his back

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ok. One.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Nooo. (He brings out his hand and is holding up two fingers.)

content.description: The Concert, the show has ended and everyone is starting to leave.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: That was amazing!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Excellent, that was excellent.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I can’t believe the guys missed this.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What guys? Oh, yeah.

content.speaker: Young Man
content.text: Excuse me, you’re Monica Geller aren’t you?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Do I know you?

content.speaker: Young Man
content.text: You used to be my babysitter.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh my god, little Stevie Fisher? How’ve you been?

content.speaker: Steve
content.text: Good, good, I’m a lawyer now.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You can’t be a lawyer. You’re eight.

content.speaker: Steve
content.text: Listen, it was nice to see you. I gotta run backstage.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Uh, wait, backstage?

content.speaker: Steve
content.text: Oh, yeah, my firm represents the band.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Ross.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Chandler.

content.speaker: Steve
content.text: How are you? Look, you guys wanna meet the group? Come on. So, are you one of the ones who fooled around with my dad?

content.description: Central Perk, Rachel, Phoebe, and Joey are there as Ross, Monica, and Chandler enter.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey, you guys.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Happy birthday.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, thank you, thanks. So uh, how was your night last night?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, well, it pretty much sucked. How was yours?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah, ours pretty much sucked, oh, but, I did run into little Stevie Fisher. Remember him?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh yeah. I used to babysit him. Hey, how’s his dad?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Uh, good.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Uh, aside from that, the whole evening was pretty much a bust.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, we really missed you guys.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, look, we were just saying, this whole thing is so stupid.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: We just have to really, really, really, not let stuff like money get—(notices something on Monica’s neck)—Is that a hickey?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No, I just, I fell down.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: On someone’s lips? Where’d you get the hickey?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You know, a party, or…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What party?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: It wasn’t so much a party as a…a gathering of people, with food, and music, and, and the band.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You partied with Hootie and the Blowfish?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yes, apparently Stevie and Hootie are like this. (Holds up crossed fingers.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Who gave you that hickey?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: That would be the work of a Blowfish.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh! I can’t believe it. I can’t believe this. We’re just like, sitting at home, trying to guess Joey’s fingers, and you guys are out like partying and having fun, and you know, all, “Hey, Blowfish, suck on my neck”.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Look, don’t blame us. You guys coulda been there, you know.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What, as part of your poor friends outreach program?
(Monica’s pager goes off)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh great, it’s work. (To Ross) Can you hand me that? (Ross hands her the phone.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I don’t know what to say. I’m sorry that we make more money than you. But we’re not gonna feel guilty about it. We work really hard for it.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: And we don’t work hard?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah, hi, it’s Monica. I just got a page.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I’m just saying that sometimes we like to do stuff that costs a little more.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: And you feel like we hold you back.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yes.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No.
(Everyone starts bickering.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Leon, Leon. Shhh! Guys. (They quiet down.) Wait, I don’t understand. Those steaks were just a gift from the meat vendor. That was not a kick back. I’ll just replace them and we can forget the whole thing. (Listens) What corporate policy? (Listens) No. (Listens) Yeah. (Listens) Okay. (Hangs up) I just got fired.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh.
(Everyone goes over to comfort Monica)

content.speaker: Waitress
content.text: Here’s your check. That’ll be $4.12.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Let me get that. (To Chandler) You got five bucks?

content.description: Chandler and Joey’s, Joey is lying on the couch as the phone rings. He’s also screening the calls.

content.speaker: Machine
content.text: Here comes the beep, you know what to do.

content.speaker: Jade
content.text: Hi, it’s me. Listen, Bob. I’m probably way out of line here. I mean, It has been 3 years, and you’re probably seeing someone else now, but if we could just have one night together, just for old time’s sake, one hot, steamy, wild night…
(Joey lunges for phone and misses.)
